name: Le Jardin d'Essai du Hamma
description: An 80-hectare garden designed in 1832 with exotic flora, research facilities, and historical significance (site of the 1932 Tarzan film). Features Moorish-inspired pavilions and shaded pathways.

name: Bardo Museum
description: Housed in a 19th-century Ottoman palace, showcases prehistoric artifacts, traditional costumes, and Roman mosaics. Highlights include Berber jewelry collections.

name: Notre Dame d'Afrique
description: Neo-Byzantine basilica (1872) offering panoramic bay views. Features a silver statue of the Virgin Mary and interfaith inscriptions in French/Arabic.

name: Casbah of Algiers
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site with Ottoman-era palaces, mosques, and labyrinthine streets. Key landmarks: Ketchaoua Mosque (1612) and Dar Hassan Pacha.

name: Martyrs' Memorial (Maqam Echahid)
description: A monument commemorating Algeria's independence struggle, featuring three palm leaves and an eternal flame

name: Ketchaoua Mosque
description: A blend of Moorish and Byzantine styles, originally a mosque, then a cathedral, and now a mosque again

name: Palais des Ra√Øs
description: A 16th-century palace showcasing Ottoman grandeur, located in the lower Casbah

name: Garden of Prague
description: Known for its vibrant street art portraits and parakeets, offering a lively atmosphere.

name: Djama√¢ El-Djaza√Ør
description: The third-largest mosque in the world, featuring the world's tallest minaret at 265 meters. It includes a prayer hall for 120,000 worshippers, a one-million book library, and a museum of Islamic art.

name: La Grande Poste d'Alger
description: A masterpiece of neo-Moorish architecture, now housing the Museum of Post and Telecommunications. Features intricate geometric patterns and vaulted ceilings.
unique_feature: Historical significance as a colonial-era post office.

name: Teri Park
description: An indoor amusement park featuring children's rides, climbing games, a 4D theater, and a food court.

name: Mus√©e des Beaux-Arts d'Alger
description: Features a diverse collection of Algerian and international art, including works from the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: Port Sidi Fredj
description: A scenic port area with historical significance as the site of the French landing in 1830. Offers beautiful views and seafood restaurants.

name: Garden City Mall
description: A premier shopping and entertainment hub in D√©ly Ibrahim, Algiers. It features a diverse range of retail outlets from international brands to local boutiques. The mall provides various dining options and recreational facilities including cinemas and play areas for children.

name: Tipaza Roman Ruins
description: Coastal UNESCO site with 3rd-century Christian basilica, Roman theater, and thermal baths. Notable for Phoenician-Roman fusion architecture.

name: Royal Mausoleum of Mauretania (Kbour-er-Roumia)
description: Ancient mausoleum believed to be the tomb of King Juba II and Queen Cleopatra Selene.

name: Chr√©a Mountains
description: A breathtaking mountain range within Chr√©a National Park, offering stunning landscapes, diverse flora and fauna, and a cool climate. It is known for its ancient Atlas cedar forests and is home to a population of the endangered Barbary macaque.

name: Monast√®re de Tibhirine
description: A monastery with historical and religious significance, located near M√©d√©a.

name: Lac Dhaya
description: A body of water near M√©d√©a, offering scenic views and a natural environment.

name: Cascade Zonday (Zonday Waterfalls)
description: A beautiful set of waterfalls located in El-Hamdania, near M√©d√©a, Algeria. It's a popular destination for hiking and day trips, offering scenic trails and natural beauty[3][6].

name: Fort Santa Cruz
description: 16th-century Spanish fortress complex with chapel and underground tunnels. Offers views of Murdjajo Mountain and Oran Bay.

name: Bey's Palace
description: 18th-century palace showcasing Ottoman architecture. Features intricate tilework and historical artifacts.

name: Ahmed Zabana National Museum
description: Features artifacts from ancient civilizations, including Roman mosaics and prehistoric tools.

name: Cathedral of the Sacred Heart of Oran
description: Roman and Byzantine landmark now serving as a public library and cultural center.

name: Oran Sea Front
description: Picturesque coastal area with stunning views and a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Canastel Forest
description: Tranquil forest area ideal for hiking and relaxation.

name: Regional Theater of Oran
description: Cultural center hosting local plays and concerts.

name: Centre Commercial et de Loisirs Es-Senia
description: A modern shopping and leisure center featuring 120 stores, 3 cinemas, a bowling alley, kids' park, library, and hypermarket. Offers a diverse dining experience with 23 restaurants.

name: AZ Mall Grand Oran
description: A shopping mall offering a variety of retail stores, dining options, and entertainment facilities.

name: Abdelhamid Ben Badis Mosque
description: Inaugurated in 2015, this mosque is a revered place of worship and a prominent symbol of Oran, known for its Andalusian-Maghrebi architectural style. It can accommodate 25,000 worshipers. Its minaret is 104 meters high and covered in glass. It's a meeting place for high-level figures.

name: Ar√®nes d'Oran
description: Originally built in 1890 (wooden structure) and rebuilt in 1908/1910, these are the only bullfighting arena in Algeria. It can host 10,000 spectators. Used for bullfighting, football, boxing, and wrestling. Reopened in 2018 after rehabilitation.

name: Disco Maghreb
description: A historic music store made famous by DJ Snake's music video. It's become a cultural landmark and a place of pilgrimage for fans of Ra√Ø music and a must-see for visitors to Oran. In 2022, French President Emmanuel Macron visited this location.

name: Sebkha of Oran
description: A salt lake located 15 km south of Oran in the municipality of Misserghin. It is a Ramsar site recognized for its importance as a habitat for migratory birds, including flamingos and other waders. The lake dries up during summer due to high evaporation rates and is surrounded by agricultural lands.

name: Great Mosque of Tlemcen
description: Built in 1082, this mosque is a highlight of Tlemcen's Islamic heritage.

name: Al Mechouar Palace
description: A Zianide Royal Palace with a rich history dating back to 1145.

name: Mansourah Ruins
description: Remains of a 14th-century citadel built by the Merinid dynasty.

name: Lalla Setti Plateau
description: Offers panoramic views of Tlemcen from a height of 1000 meters.

name: Beni Add Cave
description: A natural cave located about 30 minutes from Tlemcen.

name: El Ourit Waterfalls
description: A scenic waterfall area ideal for hiking and relaxation.

name: Marsa Ben M'hidi Beach
description: A coastal area with beaches and scenic views.

name: Mosqu√©e Sidi Boumediene
description: A mosque located in the El Eubbad district of Tlemcen. It was originally built as a tomb in 1339 by the Merinid sultan Abou l'Hassan Ali as an annex to the mausoleum of Sidi Boumediene and includes a madrasa (built in 1347), a small palace (Dar es Sult√¢n), a zaouia, a hammam, and latrines.
unique_feature: Part of a complex that includes a madrasa, a small palace, a zaouia, a hammam, and latrines.

name: Timgad Ruins
description: Complete Roman grid city (100 AD) with 3,500-seat theater, Trajan's Arch, and advanced drainage systems. Called 'Algerian Pompeii'.

name: M'Zab Valley
description: UNESCO site with pentagonal Ibadi mosques and cliffside granaries. Includes five fortified ksour (villages) dating to 11th century.

name: Cap Carbon
description: Dramatic limestone cliffs with 1906 lighthouse. Hiking trails connect to Aokas coastal caves and Gouraya National Park.

name: Constantine
description: ‚ÄòCity of Bridges‚Äô featuring Sidi M‚ÄôCid suspension bridge (1912) and Palais d'Ahmed Bey. Historic Jewish quarter with Ottoman architecture.

name: Cirta Museum
description: A well-preserved Roman mosaic depicting allegorical representations of the four seasons. Typical of Roman-era floor decorations in wealthy homes, it exhibits intricate designs and a variety of colored tiles.

name: Tassili n'Ajjer
description: UNESCO World Heritage sandstone plateau with 15,000+ Neolithic rock engravings. Features 'Crying Cow' and 'Swimming People' art sites.

name: Moul N'Aga Pass
description: Dramatic mountain pass offering panoramic desert views and ancient rock carvings. Popular for hiking and photography.

name: Tadrart Rouge
description: Stunning red sandstone formations and dunes, known as the 'Red Tadrart.' Iconic Sahara Desert landscape.

name: Essendil√®ne Valley
description: Remote valley with striking sandstone cliffs and prehistoric rock art. Ideal for off-road exploration.

name: Fort Charlet
description: 19th-century Ottoman-era fort offering insights into Djanet's history and strategic desert trade routes.

name: Iherir Valley
description: UNESCO-listed valley with freshwater springs, prehistoric engravings, and rare Saharan wildlife.

name: Tikoubaouine Arch
description: Natural sandstone arch sculpted by erosion. A breathtaking spot for sunset views and photography.

name: Sefar Rock Art Site
description: One of the most iconic rock art sites in the Tassili n'Ajjer region, featuring Neolithic-era paintings and carvings dating back to 6000 BCE. Highlights include the famous 'Great God of Sefar,' a towering humanoid figure, and vivid scenes of ancient pastoral life. A UNESCO World Heritage gem.

name: Djemila
description: Best-preserved Roman town in North Africa with Capitolium temple, 3,000-seat theater, and mosaic-filled Christian quarter.

name: Basilique Saint Augustin
description: A 19th-century basilica blending Roman, Byzantine, and Berbero-Moorish styles, perched atop the Hill of Hippo in Annaba, housing a relic of Saint Augustine.

name: Musee des Ruines d' Hippone
description: A museum showcasing artifacts from over a century of excavations at Hippo Regius, offering panoramic views of Annaba and its historical landmarks.

name: Farouk Land
description: An amusement park in Annaba offering various rides, games, and family-friendly attractions, ideal for leisure and entertainment.

name: Seraidi Forest
description: A scenic location in Sera√Ødi, known for its lush forests, mountain views, and tranquil atmosphere, ideal for nature lovers and hikers.

name: Hammam Debagh Hot Springs
description: A natural hot spring in Guelma, famous for its therapeutic waters and stunning waterfall, attracting visitors seeking relaxation and wellness.

name: Guelma Roman Theatre
description: A well-preserved ancient Roman amphitheater in Guelma, showcasing impressive architecture and hosting cultural events and performances.

name: Parc National El Kala
description: A UNESCO-listed national park in northeastern Algeria, known for its diverse ecosystems, rich wildlife, and scenic lakes, making it a paradise for nature lovers and birdwatchers.

name: National Museum of Antiquities of Algiers
description: The oldest museum in Algeria and Africa, showcasing a vast collection of classical antiquities and Islamic art from various Arab-Muslim dynasties, located in Algiers' Freedom Park.

name: Dounia Parc
description: A vast urban park in Algiers, offering lush green spaces, walking trails, recreational areas, and scenic views, perfect for relaxation and outdoor activities.

name: Villa Abd-el-Tif
description: A historic villa in Algiers, known for its Moorish architecture and artistic legacy, once home to the Abd-el-Tif Prize laureates, fostering creativity and cultural exchange.

name: Villa Boulkine
description: A 19th-century architectural gem in Hussein Dey, Algiers, once the secondary residence of Dey Hussein, now serving as the temporary home for the Grand Museum of Africa.

name: M'Zab Valley
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, M'Zab Valley features five fortified cities established in the 10th century by the Ibadites, showcasing unique medieval architecture and traditional human habitat adapted to the Sahara Desert environment.

name: Ain El Fouara Fountain
description: A renowned fountain known for its intricate sculpture and as a symbol of S√©tif.

name: S√©tif Archaeological Museum
description: Museum housing artifacts from the Roman and Byzantine periods.

name: Park Mall S√©tif
description: A modern shopping center with various retail outlets and an indoor amusement park.

name: Emir Abdelkader Mosque
description: One of the largest mosques in Algeria, showcasing stunning Ottoman-inspired architecture.

name: Pont Sidi M'Cid
description: A suspension bridge offering breathtaking panoramic views of the Rhumel Gorge.

name: Monument aux Morts
description: A war memorial perched atop a hill, providing expansive city views.

name: Palais d'Ahmed Bey
description: A historic palace reflecting Ottoman-era architecture with beautiful courtyards.

name: Hoggar Mountains
description: A breathtaking desert landscape with volcanic mountains, scenic sunrises, and home to the Assekrem Plateau.

name: Assekrem Plateau
description: A high-altitude plateau offering stunning sunrise and sunset views, famously visited by Charles de Foucauld.

name: Taghit Oasis
description: A beautiful desert oasis with massive sand dunes and palm groves, perfect for relaxation and adventure.

name: Ahaggar National Park
description: Vast protected desert park encompassing volcanic peaks, sand dunes, and archaeological sites. Home to the endangered Saharan cheetah.

name: National Museum of Ahaggar
description: A museum dedicated to preserving the cultural and natural heritage of the Ahaggar (Hoggar) region. Exhibits include Tuareg artifacts, traditional jewelry, tools, historical photographs, and displays on the area's geology, prehistoric rock art, and nomadic lifestyles. Highlights the ecological and anthropological significance of the Ahaggar Cultural Park, a UNESCO-recognized site.

name: Tazrouk Village
description: Traditional Tuareg village nestled in the Hoggar Mountains. Offers insights into nomadic lifestyles and handicrafts like silver jewelry.

name: Erg Tihoda√Øne
description: Remote dune field ideal for 4x4 safaris, camel treks, and stargazing. Known for its golden sands and isolation.

name: Tikjda National Park
description: A scenic mountain resort in the Djurdjura Range, offering skiing in winter and hiking in summer. Known for its stunning alpine views.

name: Brezina Oasis
description: An oasis town at the foot of the Saharan Atlas. Explore the traditional palm groves and witness the ancient system of water distribution. Rich in prehistoric vestiges, including rock engravings.

name: Hammam Salihine
description: Sulphur springs known for their medical properties, believed to heal skin conditions and rheumatism. Visited for recreation and increasingly popular[1][2].

name: Aqua Palm Les Jardains des Zibans Biskra
description: A water park offering recreation and entertainment.

name: Landon Garden
description: A public garden providing a relaxing venue for families. Biskra's breathtaking public gardens provide families with the perfect venue to relax and spend time together [1][2].

name: Sidna Oqba Ibn Nafi Mosque
description: A significant mosque near Biskra, reflecting the region's spiritual heritage [2].

name: Timimoun Oasis
description: A small oasis town known as the 'Red Oasis' with distinctive red mud-brick architecture in the Sudanese style. Explore the ancient Ksour, palm groves, and experience the unique blend of Berber, Arab, and African cultures.

name: Ksar Draa
description: A fascinating architectural wonder and one of the most significant and well-preserved ksars in the Timimoun region. Built in the 14th century with walls made of sand, straw, and clay, it features narrow alleys, winding staircases, and hidden courtyards. It has houses, mosques and kitchens.

name: La Gazelle d'Or Resort & Spa
description: A luxurious 4.5-star resort and spa in El Oued, offering a unique desert experience with tent and deluxe room accommodations. Features 3 outdoor pools, an indoor pool, a full-service spa, and multiple dining options serving international cuisine [1][3].

name: Qal'at Bani Hammad
description: A fortified palatine city and UNESCO World Heritage site. Founded in 1007, it served as the first capital of the Hammadid dynasty, showcasing medieval Islamic architecture. It was abandoned in 1090 and partly destroyed in 1152.

name: Djurdjura National Park
description: A natural gem in the Kabylie region, renowned for its dramatic mountain ranges, lush forests, and diverse wildlife, including the endangered Barbary Macaque. The park offers hiking trails with stunning viewpoints and is steeped in cultural significance with the local Kabyle people.

name: Beni Abbes Museum
description: A museum dedicated to desert fauna, fossils, and Algerian arts and crafts. It displays an extensive range of different types of dates, minerals, rocks, and objects from the Paleolithic and Neolithic eras. Supported by the Saharan Research Center.

name: Port de Stora
description: A picturesque fishing port near Skikda, offering stunning coastal views, fresh seafood, and a gateway to boat tours and maritime activities.

name: La Place
description: A vibrant public square in the heart of Skikda, known for its historic architecture, lively atmosphere, and a popular gathering spot for locals and visitors.

name: Madaure Ruins
description: Ancient Roman ruins in Souk Ahras, once home to a renowned university and the philosopher Apuleius, offering a glimpse into Algeria's rich classical past.

name: Thubursicum(Khamissa)
description: An ancient Roman archaeological site near Khemissa, known for its well-preserved Roman theater, forums, public baths, and other ruins that offer insight into the city's historical significance.

name: lacs de Burgas
description: The Burgas Lakes near Taoura in Souk Ahras are the largest natural lakes in the region. They are a peaceful haven for many birds, including flamingos and the rare white-headed duck. The area offers stunning landscapes and a unique spot for nature lovers and birdwatchers.

name: The olive tree of St. Augustine
description: a revered 2,900-year-old olive tree in Souk Ahras, Algeria, where Saint Augustine is said to have meditated and written under its branches alongside his mother, Saint Monica. Certified by dendrochronology in 1953, this ancient symbol of faith and resilience‚Äîlinked to biblical figures and Mediterranean history‚Äîdraws pilgrims and scholars alike. Restored in 2005 with Italian collaboration, the site now features a museum and stands as a spiritual landmark, echoing UNESCO‚Äôs World Olive Day (November 26) as a testament to its global cultural and religious legacy.

name: Mujahid Museum
description: honors Algeria‚Äôs fight for freedom (1954‚Äì1962) with photos, weapons, and stories of local heroes. Located in a historic city, it‚Äôs a moving tribute to courage and sacrifice. Perfect for understanding Algeria‚Äôs past. üá©üáø

name: Mosque of Al-Aman
description: is a stunning modern mosque in the city center, built from 2011 to 2016. It holds 4,400 worshippers and includes a Quranic school, a 200-seat library, and parking. With its elegant design, it‚Äôs a peaceful place for prayer and cultural discovery.

name: Lac Tonga
description: A freshwater lake within El Kala National Park, recognized as a Ramsar site, providing a crucial habitat for aquatic plants and migratory birds, making it a paradise for nature lovers and birdwatchers.

name: Monument historique de Challe et Maurice
description: A significant historical monument located in Ain El Assel, El Tarf, Algeria, recognized for its cultural heritage and national significance.

name: Palais de Lala Fatma
description: An ancient Roman-era site located in a cork oak forest near Oued Djenane, showcasing remnants from Roman, Byzantine, and Islamic periods, recently designated as a national protected archaeological site.

name: √âglise Saint Cyprien
description: A historic Catholic church in El kala, serving as a significant place of worship for the local Christian community.

name: Zoo Brabtia et Aqua Park
description: A combined zoological and aquatic amusement park in El Kala, featuring a variety of wildlife species, water attractions, and family-friendly entertainment.

name: Mosqu√©e El-Atik 'Ibn Khaldoune'
description: One of Guelma's oldest mosques, blending Ottoman and French architectural influences, located centrally on Rue Malika Bouzit.

name: √éle Srigina
description: √éle Srigina is a small island located at the western entrance of Skikda's harbor in Algeria. The island's name is believed to originate from the Punic term 'rus gunia,' meaning 'cape of the creek.'

name: Grottes de Wadi Bo‚Äôkouz
description: A fascinating cave system in T√©bessa, Algeria, known for its geological formations and natural beauty, attracting adventure seekers and nature lovers.

name: Naqrine et Farkan
description: Naqrine et Farkan is a tourist site located in the Fatima Zahra district of T√©bessa, Algeria. Specific details about the site's features and attractions are limited.

name: Timerkanine Lake
description: Recognized internationally under the Ramsar Convention, the lake is a popular destination for tourists seeking relaxation and leisure, as well as a natural laboratory for scientific tourism, attracting students and researchers.

name: N√©cropole m√©galithique de Sefia
description: The site was registered in 1900 and classified as a national heritage site on January 23, 1968.

name: Sidi Rghis Mount Forest
description: The forest is characterized by its lush greenery and diverse vegetation, including Aleppo pine, oak, wormwood, and cork trees. It serves as a habitat for various wildlife species such as wild rabbits, blond foxes, jackals, eagles, and partridges.

name: Mosqu√©e El Atique
description: The mosque showcases traditional Algerian Islamic architecture, featuring intricate tile work and stunning calligraphy, reflecting the region's rich Islamic heritage.

name: Zoo de Oum El Bouaghi
description: it serves as a popular destination for both locals and visitors seeking leisure and educational experiences.

name: Beni Belaid Beach East
description: A serene beach known for its clear waters and tranquil environment.

name: Beni Belaid Beach west
description: Popular for its golden sands and family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Lake of Beni Belaid
description: A picturesque lake adjacent to the beach, ideal for picnics and bird-watching.

name: Plage Sidi Abdelaziz
description: Known for its scenic beauty and clear blue waters, attracting both locals and tourists.

name: Plage Rocher aux Moules
description: Features unique rock formations and is popular among snorkeling enthusiasts.

name: El Djenah
description: A beautiful beach offering stunning sunsets and a peaceful environment.

name: Plage Kotama
description: A lively beach known for its local eateries and vibrant atmosphere.

name: Grand Phare
description: Located near a historic lighthouse, offering panoramic views and a glimpse into maritime history.

name: Zouai
description: A hidden gem with crystal-clear waters and soft sandy shores, ideal for relaxation.

name: Rabta
description: A tranquil beach near Jijel city, offering scenic views and a relaxing environment.

name: La Crique
description: A stunning beach with rocky cliffs and breathtaking sea views, perfect for photography.

name: Plage d'Ouled Bounnar
description: A peaceful beach surrounded by nature, ideal for family outings and picnics.

name: Taza National Park
description: A UNESCO-recognized biosphere reserve, Taza National Park boasts diverse flora and fauna, including the endangered Barbary macaque. Visitors can explore its lush forests and scenic mountains.

name: Caves of Jijel (Grottes Merveilleuses)
description: Known as the 'Marvelous Caves,' these limestone caves feature stunning stalactites and stalagmites, offering visitors a unique subterranean experience.

name: Island of El Aouana
description: A picturesque island located 950 meters off the coast, accessible by boat. It's ideal for short boat trips, sightseeing, and exploring the natural beauty.

name: Grand Phare (Great Lighthouse)
description: This historic lighthouse offers panoramic views of the Mediterranean Sea and the surrounding coastline, making it a popular spot for photography and sightseeing.

name: Kotama Museum
description: A museum showcasing the rich history and cultural heritage of the Jijel region, featuring artifacts, traditional crafts, and historical exhibits.

name: Animal Park - Kissir El Aouana
description: A family-friendly park home to various animal species, offering visitors the chance to observe wildlife in a natural setting.

name: Baba Arroudj Fortress
description: A historic fortress dating back to the Ottoman era, offering a glimpse into Algeria's rich maritime history.

name: Ziama Mansouriah
description: A charming coastal town known for its picturesque scenery, local seafood cuisine, and peaceful environment.

name: Ouled Djellal Sand Dunes
description: Expansive dunes offering breathtaking sunset views and an authentic desert experience.

name: Oued El Bared
description: A scenic river with crystal-clear waters, surrounded by lush greenery and rocky cliffs.

name: El Firma Club
description: A family-friendly leisure complex offering swimming pools, sports activities, and relaxation areas.

name: Ain Droj Fountain
description: A historic natural fountain known for its refreshing mineral-rich waters and tranquil surroundings.

name: Al Moujahidin Museum
description: A museum dedicated to the history of Algeria‚Äôs independence movement, featuring artifacts and documents from the war.

name: Bougaa Mountains
description: A breathtaking mountainous region perfect for hiking, picnicking, and nature exploration.

name: Megress Mountains
description: A breathtaking mountainous region perfect for hiking, picnicking, and nature exploration.

name: Hammam Sokhna
description: A natural hot spring surrounded by beautiful landscapes, offering therapeutic mineral waters.

name: Hammam Guergour
description: A famous thermal spa known for its sulfur-rich hot springs, ideal for relaxation and health benefits.

name: A√Øn L'Hanech Archaeological Site
description: One of the oldest human sites, possibly marking the first human presence. It features 1.7-million-year-old stone tools and early human remains, making it a key prehistoric site in North Africa.

name: A√Øn Salah Sand Dunes
description: Expansive sand dunes offering a quintessential Sahara experience, ideal for sandboarding and camel treks.

name: Soumaa Plateau
description: A vast highland region with stunning landscapes, caves, and prehistoric sites.

name: Timimoun Oasis
description: A picturesque desert oasis with lush palm groves and traditional red mudbrick architecture.

name: Djurdjura National Park
description: A stunning mountain range home to rare wildlife, deep caves, and breathtaking hiking trails.

name: A√Øt Ouabane Village
description: A breathtaking Kabyle village nestled in the Djurdjura mountains, known for its traditional architecture and stunning views.

name: Beni Yenni
description: A historic Kabyle village famous for its traditional silver jewelry craftsmanship and panoramic mountain scenery.

name: Yakouren Forest
description: A lush forest perfect for hiking, picnicking, and spotting wildlife, offering a cool retreat in summer.

name: Tizi N'Kouilal
description: A scenic mountain pass with panoramic views, winding roads, and a gateway to many traditional Kabyle villages.

name: Oued Sebaou River
description: A picturesque river with lush surroundings, offering relaxing spots for picnicking and enjoying nature.

name: Azeffoun Beach
description: A serene Mediterranean beach with crystal-clear waters and golden sands.

name: Tighramt Park
description: A family-friendly park with playgrounds, walking trails, and green spaces for relaxation.

name: Thala Guilef
description: A scenic mountain area with fresh springs, dense forests, and a peaceful environment for hiking and relaxation.

name: Barbadjani Beach
description: A secluded beach accessible only by boat, known for its natural beauty and historical significance. It features a freshwater spring and is nestled under a large cliff.

name: Sbiat Beach
description: A picturesque beach with a presqu'√Æle and several islets. It is popular for camping and offers a serene natural environment.

name: Madagh Beach
description: Comprises two beaches, Madagh 1 and Madagh 2, separated by a small mountain. Known for its crystal-clear waters and scenic surroundings.

name: Les Andalouses Beach
description: A popular beach with golden sand, part of a large tourist complex offering various amenities and activities like water sports.

name: Cap Falcon
description: A cape with a historic lighthouse, offering scenic views of the Mediterranean Sea.

name: Cap Rousseau
description: A scenic cape with beaches and natural beauty, known for its historic significance.

name: Cap Djenat
description: A cape with beaches and natural beauty, part of the El Kala National Park.

name: Dellys Beach
description: A popular beach town with scenic views and historic sites.

name: Tichy Beach
description: A popular beach in B√©ja√Øa, offering scenic views and local amenities.

name: Collo Beach
description: A scenic beach in Collo, known for its natural beauty and local charm.

name: Village Ait El Kaid
description: A traditional village known for its historical and cultural heritage.

name: Grotte Ifri n-teriel
description: An ancient cave located in Agouni Gueghrane, known for its cultural significance and historical artifacts

name: La Grotte d'Anou
description: A mysterious cave with natural formations, perfect for exploration.

name: Main du Juif
description: a striking rock formation in Tizi Ouzou, known for its unique shape resembling a hand

name: Ifri N'Dlal
description: A grotto carved into the rock, containing inscriptions in ancient Berber script.

name: Ancient Villages Aourir and Moknea
description: Traditional Kabyle villages.

name: Ruines romaines
description: Ancient Roman ruins

name: Plage les Caroubiers
description: A beautiful beach on the northwestern coast of Azeffoun, ideal for relaxation.

name: Plage Sidi-Khelifa
description: A serene beach to the northeast of Azeffoun, known for its peaceful atmosphere.

name: Petit Paradis
description: A picturesque area offering beautiful natural views and serene surroundings.

name: Plage Corso
description: A beach known for its beautiful coastline and clear waters.

name: Plage Boudouaou El Bahri
description: A serene beach offering a peaceful atmosphere for visitors.

name: Plage Souffleur
description: A beautiful and well-known beach in Zemmouri with crystal-clear waters.

name: Plage du Figuier
description: A quiet beach known for its fig trees and tranquil environment.

name: Aokas Craftsmanship Center (Centre de l'Artisanat √† Aokas)
description: A craft center with 22 workshops dedicated to various local art forms.

name: House of the Soummam Congress (Maison du Congr√®s de la Soummam)
description: A historic house where key meetings of the Algerian revolution took place.

name: Tomb of Sheikh Ahddad (Tombeau de Chikh Ahddad)
description: A significant historical site related to Sheikh Ahddad, a major figure in the local history.

name: Tomb of El Mokrani (Tombeau d'El Mokrani)
description: The final resting place of El Mokrani, a local hero

name: Museum of Ifri
description: a cultural and historical site known for its significance during the Algerian War

name: Roman Ruins of Tiklate (Les Ruines Romaines de Tiklate)
description: Ancient Roman ruins

name: Touja Spring (Source de l'Eau Touja)
description: A natural spring that provides fresh water

name: Black Lake of Akfadou (Le Lac Noir Akfadou)
description: A mysterious and beautiful lake nestled in the mountains

name: Kherrata Gorges (Les Gorges de Kherrata)
description: a natural rock formations known for their deep cliffs and scenic views, popular for hiking and nature exploration

name: Brise de Mer
description: A charming seaside area in Bejaia, perfect for a relaxing walk by the sea.

name: Yemma Gouraya
description: A famous mountain in Bejaia, offering hiking trails and panoramic views of the city and the sea

name: Aiguades Beaches (Plages les Aiguades)
description: Known for their crystal-clear waters and picturesque views

name: Kefrida Waterfall (Cascade de Kefrida)
description: A stunning natural waterfall, ideal for nature lovers and those looking to escape into a tranquil environment.

name: Place du 1er Novembre
description: A central square in Bejaia, it holds historical significance and is a lively gathering place for locals and visitors alike.

name: Bab El Fouka
description: A significant historical gateway, representing the architectural and cultural heritage of Bejaia.

name: Monkey Peak (Pic des Singes)
description: A popular hiking destination offering breathtaking views and known for its population of Barbary monkeys.

name: Chenoua Beach (Plage de Chenoua)
description: A beautiful beach in Tipaza, known for its crystal-clear waters and scenic views

name: Plage Saint-Cloud
description: Plage Saint-Cloud, also known as Plage Fellah Rachid, is a popular beach located north of Annaba, Algeria. Renowned for its expansive shoreline and scenic beauty, it attracts visitors year-round due to its convenient location and accessibility.

name: Plage Chapuis (Rizzi Amor)
description: Plage Chapuis, also known as Rizzi Amor, is a popular beach in Annaba, featuring fine, high-quality sand stretching over several hundred meters. It is one of the four beautiful beaches located in the northern part of Annaba.

name: Plage Sable d'Or Cheta√Øbi
description: Plage Sable d'Or, located in Cheta√Øbi, Annaba,Visitors can enjoy sunbathing, swimming, and exploring the natural beauty of the area.

name: Plage Sable d'Or Cheta√Øbi
description: Plage Sable d'Or, located in Cheta√Øbi, Annaba,Visitors can enjoy sunbathing, swimming, and exploring the natural beauty of the area.

name: plage El Marsa
description: El Marsa is a picturesque coastal village located approximately 60 kilometers east of Skikda. Once a simple fishing village, it has transformed into a popular tourist destination, attracting visitors with its expansive sandy beaches, charming pebble coves, and scenic calanques.

name: Plage Vieille Calle
description: Plage Vieille Calle, located in El Kala, El Tarf Province, is renowned for its extensive stretch of golden sand and clear blue waters.

name: Plage Echatt
description: Plage Echatt is a serene beach located in the town of Echatt, near Annaba, The beach is a popular spot among locals, especially during the summer months, providing a peaceful retreat from the bustling city life.

name: Plage Djenane El Bey
description: Plage Djenane El Bey, also known as Plage Oued Boqrat, is a serene beach located near Sera√Ødi in the Annaba province of Algeria.

name: Plage Bikini
description: Plage Bikini is a beach located near the village of Stora in Skikda, Algeria. It extends from the grand bend to the edge of the fishing port's jetty.

name: Plage Bleu 2
description: A compact beach adorned with rocks, offering opportunities for swimming, picnicking, and various recreational water activities.

name: Plage Sacr√©e Gouraya
description: A serene beach located in Boukhlidja, Gouraya, known for its natural beauty and tranquil atmosphere.

name: Patrice Lumumba Garden
description: Established in 1858 during the French colonial era as Jardin Bizot, this historic garden was renamed in 1968 to honor Congolese independence leader Patrice Lumumba.

name: Iron Park
description: Iron Park offers a variety of amenities including a gym, billiards, fast food restaurants, and a cafeteria, making it a popular spot for both fitness enthusiasts and families seeking leisure activities.

name: Jewish Cemetery of Blida
description: The Jewish Cemetery of Blida stands as a testament to the city's once-thriving Jewish community. Although the Jewish population in Blida has significantly diminished since Algeria's independence, the cemetery remains a historical site reflecting the rich cultural tapestry of the region.

name: Amoura
description: Amoura, historically known as Sufasar, is a commune in Djelfa Province, Algeria. It holds significance as an ancient Roman town in the province of Mauretania Caesariensis.

name: Ain al-Naqah Rock Carvings
description: The Ain al-Naqah Rock Carvings are a nationally recognized archaeological site. The site comprises six stations featuring a total of 71 prehistoric rock engravings, offering valuable insights into the region's ancient history and art.

name: Senalba Forest
description: Senalba Forest, located near Djelfa, Algeria, is a significant natural reserve known for its dense Aleppo pine (Pinus halepensis) woodlands.

name: Agoulmime Lake
description: Agoulmime Lake, also known as Tamda n Agoulmime, is a high-altitude alpine lake situated at approximately 1,700 meters in the Djurdjura Mountains of northern Algeria.

name: Petit Vichy Garden
description: Petit Vichy Garden is Known for its lush greenery and tranquil ambiance, the garden offers visitors a peaceful retreat with well-maintained walking paths, shaded seating areas, and a variety of local flora.

name: Mosqu√©e Al-Houda
description: Mosqu√©e Al-Houda serves as a central hub for the local Muslim community, hosting daily prayers and religious gatherings.

name: Dar Eddaya
description: Dar Eddaya is a charming guest house located in the residential neighborhood of Hai Ennour in El Oued, Algeria.

name: Sbeaat Beach
description: Sbeaat Beach is a tranquil spot featuring soft golden sands and gentle waves. Surrounded by natural cliffs and pine trees, it offers a perfect escape for those seeking peace and quiet.

name: Cap Figalo Beach
description: Cap Figalo Beach is known for its rugged coastline and deep blue waters. Ideal for snorkeling and coastal walks, the area offers stunning views of the Mediterranean horizon.

name: Sassel Beach
description: Sassel Beach is a popular family destination, appreciated for its calm waters and wide sandy areas. Local vendors often sell snacks and souvenirs near the entrance.

name: Bou_Zadjar Beach
description: Bou Zadjar Beach is admired for its clear waters and nearby hiking paths. It's a great location for a day trip combining swimming, exploration, and photography.

name: Plage Rachgoun Beach
description: Plage Rachgoun is one of the region's most iconic beaches, offering views of Rachgoun Island. It's perfect for sunrise walks and peaceful swims in crystal-clear waters.

name: Sidi Djelloul Beach
description: Sidi Djelloul Beach is tucked between rocky cliffs and is appreciated for its wild, untouched nature. It‚Äôs a hidden gem ideal for adventurers and nature lovers.

name: Terga Beach
description: Terga Beach offers a perfect balance between relaxation and activity. Its calm bay is great for swimming, and its promenade attracts families and tourists alike.

name: Medegh 1 Beach
description: Medegh 1 Beach stands out for its dramatic cliffs and natural beauty. It's less crowded than other beaches, offering a peaceful atmosphere for contemplation and seaside picnics.

name: Pont Sidi Rached
description: Completed in 1912, the Sidi Rached Bridge is a multiple-span arch viaduct that crosses the Rhummel River gorge, connecting the Coudiat district to Constantine's train station. At the time of its construction, it was the tallest concrete bridge in the world, featuring 27 arches with the largest spanning 70 meters.

name: Pont El Kantara
description: The El Kantara Bridge is the oldest in Constantine, originally serving as a Roman aqueduct. Reconstructed multiple times, the current concrete arch bridge was completed in the 19th century, spanning the Rhumel River gorge and connecting different parts of the city.

name: Pont Mellah Slimane
description: Opened in April 1925, the Mellah Slimane Bridge is a 125-meter-long suspension footbridge that stands approximately 110 meters above the Rhumel River. It connects the train station neighborhood to the old town center, offering pedestrians a thrilling crossing experience.

name: Th√©√¢tre R√©gional Mohamed Tahar Fergani
description: Established in 1973, the Regional Theatre of Constantine was renamed in 2017 to honor the renowned Malouf singer Mohamed-Tahar Fergani. Located in the heart of the city, the theatre hosts a variety of performances, including plays, concerts, and cultural events.

name: Jardin de l'Aqueduc Romain
description: The Roman Aqueduct Garden offers a serene environment with lush greenery and historical significance. Located near the remnants of an ancient Roman aqueduct, it's an ideal spot for relaxation and leisurely walks.

name: Monts Chelia
description: Monts Chelia, also known as Djebel Ch√©lia, is the highest peak in the Aur√®s Mountains and the second highest in Algeria, standing at 2,328 meters. Located west of Khenchela in Bouhmama county, it offers panoramic views and is a popular spot for hikers and nature enthusiasts.

name: Canyon de Ghoufi
description: The Ghoufi Canyon, also known as the Balconies of Ghoufi, is a breathtaking site located in the Aur√®s region. This deep canyon features ancient cave dwellings carved into its cliffs and overlooks a lush oasis, offering a glimpse into the area's rich history and natural beauty.

name: Parc National de Djebel Aissa
description: Established in 2003, Djebel Aissa National Park spans 24,400 hectares in the Saharan Atlas region. It boasts diverse landscapes, including mountains, valleys, and forests, and is home to various endemic and endangered species, making it a haven for wildlife enthusiasts.

name: Lac Agulmim
description: Lac Agulmim, situated in the Tikejda region, is a serene mountain lake surrounded by lush greenery and rocky landscapes. It's a popular spot for picnics, nature walks, and offers stunning views, especially during sunrise and sunset.

name: Les Jardins des Ziban
description: A popular water park offering a variety of fun water-based activities and relaxation areas for families and tourists looking to cool off.

name: La plage de Sidi Lakhdar
description: Located in the commune of Sidi Lakhdar, this beach is renowned for its golden sands and clear waters, providing an ideal setting for swimming and water sports.

name: Salamandre Beach
description: A beautiful and peaceful beach known for its golden sand, crystal-clear waters, and picturesque views, perfect for a relaxing day by the sea.

name: Marsa Ben M‚ÄôHidi beach
description: Known for its fine sand and crystal-clear waters, this beach is ideal for swimming and water sports. It also offers amenities such as restrooms and free parking.

name: Hadjadj beach 2
description: A serene beach known for its clear waters and tranquil environment, suitable for swimming and relaxation.

name: Hadjadj beach 1
description: A serene beach known for its clear waters and tranquil environment, suitable for swimming and relaxation.

name: Parc Mosta Land
description: An amusement park offering a variety of rides and attractions for families and children.

name: Mausoleum of Medghacen
description: A royal Numidian mausoleum, a symbol of Algeria's ancient heritage, offering insights into the region‚Äôs early civilizations.

name: 1st November Mosque
description: An iconic mosque with symbolic value, reflecting Algeria's historical struggle for independence.

name: Lambaesis Ruins
description: Ancient Roman military site featuring impressive ruins, including a theater, baths, and temple ruins.

name: Belezma National Park
description: A national park known for its rich biodiversity, lush forests, and serene hiking trails, ideal for nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts.

name: Hammam Maskhoutine
description: Located in the dramatic valley of Hammam Debagh, Hammam Maskhoutine is famous for its unique volcanic rock formations and steaming hot springs reaching temperatures up to 98¬∞C. The site includes spectacular travertine walls and petrified formations, known as the 'petrified wedding guests', tied to ancient local folklore.

name: Hammam Melouane
description: A relaxing thermal spa located in a lush natural setting near Algiers, Hammam Melouane offers naturally heated pools, a spa center, and comfortable accommodations. It is ideal for stress relief and wellness therapy, especially during weekdays.
